verses.roman:
vairocanāya saṁrabdho
bhagavān pāka-śāsanaḥ
udayacchad yadā vajraṁ
prajā hā heti cukruśuḥ

synonyms: vairocanāya—unto Bali Mahārāja (just to kill him); saṁrabdhaḥ—being very angry; bhagavān—the most powerful; pāka-śāsanaḥ—Indra; udayacchat—took in his hand; yadā—at which time; vajram—the thunderbolt; prajāḥ—all the demons; hā hā—alas, alas; iti—thus; cukruśuḥ—began to resound.
translation: When the most powerful Indra became angry and took his thunderbolt in hand to kill Mahārāja Bali, the demons began lamenting, "Alas, alas!"
